mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, James M. Brown to John Augustine Washington III, 1851 November 5
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Brown, James M.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Brown writes about selling some of John Augustine's lands. On the back of the letter, he asks if the remains of George Washington's old coffin is still in the old vault at Mount Vernon. If so, Brown, writes, he can identify the pieces and place them at the National Institute for "more perfect preservation." Autograph letter signed, 2 pages.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Washington, George, 1732-1799--Old tomb
